titleStmt.title: By the Protector. A proclamation commanding all persons who have been in arms, or assisted in the wars against the state, to depart out of the cities of London and Westminster and late lines of communication, on or before the twelfth day of September instant.
titleStmt.author: England and Wales. Lord Protector (1653-1658 : O. Cromwell)
England and Wales. Council of State.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by Henry Hills and John Feild, Printers to His Highness,

notesStmt.note: Dated at end: Given at Whitehall the 6. day of September, in the year of our Lord, 1656.
In consequence of the meeting of Parliament all malignants are to leave London, &c., before 12 September next and not to return for six months, on pain, &c.--Steele.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
